name: Epinephrine 1:1,000

pedi: Anaphylaxis [PM1] < 30kg 0.15 repeat every 5 minutes if no improvement
>= 30kg 0.3-0.5mg repeat every 5 minutes if no improvement
Respiratory Distress [AR7] - 1mg epi + 2ml nasal saline {Nebulizer} repeat x1 if no improvment
adult: Anaphylaxis [AM1] [AR4] - 0.3-0.5mg - [AM1] Repeat every 5 minutes if no improvement
COPD/Asthma [AR4] - 1mg epi + 2ml nasal saline {Nebulizer} repeat x1 if no improvment

pearls: [AM1] In Anaphylaxis - IM Epinephrine should be administered in priority before or during attempts at IV or IO access or other drugs
[AM1] Anaphylaxis unresponsive to repeat doses of IM epinephrine may require IV epinephrine administration by IV push or epinephrine infusion. Contact Medical Control for appropriate dosing
[AR4] [AR7] COPD/Asthma - Consider epinephrine with failure to improve and/or impending respiratory failure

[AR7] Bronchiolitis is a viral infection typically affecting infants which results in wheezing which may not respond to beta-agonists.  Consider Epinephrine nebulizer if patient < 18 months and not responding to initial beta-agonist treatment
AEMTs are not permitted to administer Epinephrine as a vasopressor to support blood pressure.
